sub_title:
Supply Chain Mgt:
- Strategy & IT
- Infrastructure
- Blue Sheet Biz Development
- Finance
- Project Mgt & Biz Impl
summary:
Allround, hands-on generalist with 25 years of experience in Contract Logistics in Supply chains of Food Service, Petrol industry, Electronic consumer goods and High Tech.

•      Continuous improvement of logistic processes in production & distribution of outlets / restaurants
•       New business development, setting up business cases, acquisition of strategic customers, 
        project management and  business implementation
•	Strategy developer with financial and business analytical starting point; Cost& Profit driven
•	Lean Operations Management. Process Improvement  based on analysis of KPI's and P&L &
        Lean Management techniques
•	Extensive knowledge of operations research, ERP systems, lean management techniques &  
        project management tools like Prince2.
•	Develop and implement innovative Supply chain systems with impact

Successfully managed several complex international projects as well as business turnarounds. Style: Integrate & align, send clear messages and consider possible wins & losses of participants. Be a real people manager but come up with sustainable results.

Entrepreneurial family background. Learned at an early age how to organize, how to serve 
customers (corporate and entrepreneurs) and to take initiative.

education.field_of_study: The best presentation and negotiations skills

projects.title: Acqusition and set-up of the second biggest customer of Havi Logistics in Europe
projects.description:
- Acquisition of the second biggest customer and successful start in test markets Bulgaria and Slovakia
- Roll out to biggest customer's company market Romania and also to Serbia
- Setting up infrastructure and finding investors
- Selecting and staffing teams

In der Ruhe liegt die Kraft

profile_positions.description:
Klumm Interim Management & Business Consultancy is an independant organization analyzing and improving logistic processes in production and distribution while identifying and removing bottlenecks.
This on top management and board level.

The services consist of:
- operations analysis, identification and elimination of bottlenecks
- implementation of process improvements and innovations
- setting up, implementing and realization of the strategy process
- business development 
- tender management
- developping, structuring and implementation of projects and project organisations
- starting up a business
- business turnaround & change management
- controlling: getting insight in figures and KPI's and developping an action plan

Specialities:
- Helicopter view but also hands on and from time to time surprisingly innovative. 
- Generalist and expert
- Analysis of P&L, balance sheet and KPI's

Klumm Interim Management has a lot of international and intercultural experience. Assignments outside the Netherlands are definitely possible.

Below enclosed find the most important projects:
profile_positions.title: Chief Problem Solver

profile_positions.description: Analysis of situation and processes in the main warehouse in Bocholt and in the 8 external warehouses. Finalized a ready to implement improvement proposal for the main DC.
profile_positions.title: Operations Consultancy at Fiege (a.i.)

profile_positions.description:
Target was to secure a business with a big international FMCG customer.
Gap between tender and Actual result had to be identified and evaluated.  Operational processes are screened and benchmarked with the objective to identify further improvement potential. Improvement proposals delivered.
profile_positions.title: Operational and Financial Audit  @DBSchenker (a.i.)

profile_positions.description:
Project Lead of successful implementation new acquired printing business.
Setting up project plan, master data, processes, IT setup, logistic infrastructure (including external overflow warehouse) and operations organization.
Communication and negotiation with supply chain partners and customer.
After go-life phase one finetuning operations and preparation for phase two.
Go life phase two successfully finalized and handover to operations
profile_positions.title: Program Management HP EMEA at LGI (a.i.)

profile_positions.description: Contract Fulfillment: Building up Financial & KPI Reporting for Open Book; Key Account Management
profile_positions.title: Key Account Management FMCG @ DB Schenker NV (a.i.)
Interim Operations Management HP EMEA Cluster at LGI (ad interim)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility
Heading the business area Central Europe (1.200 employees, 15 DC's and 20% share in the profit of Europe) with subsidiaries in Poland, Romania, Austria, Slovenia, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, Croatia, Bosnia-Hercegovina, Serbia and Bulgaria. Member of the European Management Team.
11 direct reports: MD’s of the countries (& clusters), and the regional directors Finance, HR, IT and Business Development. 

Main Achievments:
Acquisition of two Key Accounts. Turnover increased with 96%. 
Both Key Accounts together form the second biggest strategic business unit with a 10% share in the group profit. Increased share of new customers from 3,4% to 36,5% (generic growth rate of the existing business was 32%!)
This was the breakthrough for the new strategy.

Biggest business implementation within HAVI planned, prepared, set up and successfully executed in Romania. Project management was according to principles of Prince2. Within a year the organization grew from 80 to 300 employees and from 1 Dc to three DC's whereof one had to be build from the scratch in an area of the country which was underdevelopped.
Project was finalized succesfully on time and on budget. Within the first year break-even was reached.
Another main task was the professionalizing of the country organizations. A 100% service and performance oriented organization had to be transformed into a more commercial
one. This could be achieved through intensive and transparant communicvation and target setting process with the MD's, their MT's and the employees and embracing and introducing the Miller Heiman Strategic Selling method (especially blue & green sheet).
Profit increased with 115%, 

Havi Global Logistics (HGL) is a subsidiary of the Havi Group. Turnover of roughly € 5 bln with 5.700 employees. The Havi Group employs in more than 100 countries roughly 9.000 employees.
The Havi Group is among the top 20 private owned businesses in the US.
profile_positions.title: Regional Director Central Europe & Vice President Havi Global Logistics

profile_positions.description:
My role as a MD of MPP GmbH was to represent the interests of the management versus the majority shareholder during Shareholder and Advisory Board as well as informal meetings with the ambition to remain a successful, customer focused and independent company.

MPP had a 15,9% share in Havi Global Logistics (earlier Alpha Management). 
Shareholders of MPP were the top 60 managers of the company.
profile_positions.title: Supervisory Board Member of Havi Global Logistics

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility:
Originally managing the companies in Belgium and the Netherlands (350 FTE's).
Management of the holding and three operational subsidiaries. 
Eight direct reports, MD Belgium, and the managers Finance, Operations, Customer Service, Procurement, Environmental Services, HR and Office.

Starting 2007 enlarged role: Managing the subsidiaries in Poland, Hungary, Belgium and the Netherlands (750 employees). Twelve direct reports: MD's fromPoland, Hongary and Belgium and the Dutch MT; myself continuing being MD of the Dutch entities

Achievements:
Took over the Dutch business in a challenging period. Regained trust from the customer (2002), Succesfully managed turnaround and made business profitable (2003). 
Succesfull design and implementation of an innovative countrywide distribution system. Therefore awarded the European Customer Award of the Year (2002). 
Acquisition of the strategic customer BP in the Netherlands. This was the first success of the new commercial strategy of Havi Global Logistics. Succesfull implementation. Achieved within one year break-even. Turnover +25%, # of employees +18%. 
Contribution to the Group Award for the new concept and the open, constructive and innovative thinking.
Acquired and set up new strategic business in Poland (2008). Trunover +60% within 1 year. 
Cost reduction in Netherlands achieved through strategic repositioning. Relocation of the operation to a greenfield DC (2008) while succesfully selling the old DC in the middle with significant impact on the profit of the whole group.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility:
Started as Finance Director with the mission to build up the administration, to find and train a successor and to handover responsibility to him.
Administration was built up from a Chief Accountant only to a complete administration with the functions Accounting, Controlling, Treasury, IT and HR.
Implemented Reporting, Forecasting, Budgeting and LTP. 
Based on the LTP the strategic decision was taken to further decentralize and add an additional distribution center in Silesia.
This enabled further growth with reduced cost per unit.
Introduced in house management seminars, attracted management talent from inside and outside of the company. Identified successor, trained him and handed over duties. 

There after taken over responsibility for the whole company (200 employees). Six direct reports: Managers Finance, Procurement & Customer Service, Operations, IT, HR and Office.
Achievements:
Income growth 20% p.a. in average. Profit over the whole period increased with more than 200%.
Realized customer specific green field distribution center in Warsaw (15% below budget). 
Turnaround during BSE-crisis.
Built a succesfull MT. 
Logpol belonged to the Top 500 companies in Poland.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director Poland / Managing Director Finance Poland

profile_positions.description:
- Implementing the infrastructure, IT and administration
- Setting up and starting succesfully operations in this new fast growing market
- Setting up all administrational processes, reporting and budgeting
- Buying the plot for future expansion and cost per unit reduction
- Building up strong relationship with the customers
- Hiring and training future management team
profile_positions.title: Interim Managing Director

volunteer_experiences.role: Treasurer of three congregations and five related trusts

Change Management and professionalization.
Automatization of financial and administrational processes in order to gain control on document flow and payments as well as to increase transparency of all processes thus being able to efficiently steer results.
Impementation of the workflow program Blue10.
Implementation Financial Software Exact Online.
Successful tendering and  outsourcing of processes.
Introduction and implementation of Reporting and Controlling.
Transparency, efficiency and time to market increased. Cost reduced.
